title: Errors get emitted twice
body:
```
error[E0282]: type annotations needed
  --> src/operator.rs:58:26
   |
58 |                 let () = err!(TypeNotPrimitive(left_ty))?;
   |                          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ cannot infer type for `_`

error[E0282]: type annotations needed
  --> src/operator.rs:58:26
   |
58 |                 let () = err!(TypeNotPrimitive(left_ty))?;
   |                          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ cannot infer type for `_`

error[E0495]: cannot infer an appropriate lifetime for autoref due to conflicting requirements
  --> src/tls.rs:95:36
   |
95 |             self.data.thread_local.range_mut((start, Unbounded))
   |                                    ^^^^^^^^^
   |
note: first, the lifetime cannot outlive the anonymous lifetime #1 defined on the method body at 85:5...
  --> src/tls.rs:85:5
   |
85 | /     fn fetch_tls_dtor(
86 | |         &mut self,
87 | |         key: Option<TlsKey>,
88 | |     ) -> EvalResult<'tcx, Option<(ty::Instance<'tcx>, Scalar, TlsKey)>> {
...  |
105| |         return Ok(None);
106| |     }
   | |_____^
note: ...so that reference does not outlive borrowed content
  --> src/tls.rs:95:13
   |
95 |             self.data.thread_local.range_mut((start, Unbounded))
   |             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
note: but, the lifetime must be valid for the lifetime 'tcx as defined on the impl at 21:1...
  --> src/tls.rs:21:1
   |
21 | impl<'a, 'mir, 'tcx: 'mir + 'a> MemoryExt<'tcx> for Memory<'a, 'mir, 'tcx, Evaluator<'tcx>> {
   | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   = note: ...so that the expression is assignable:
           expected std::result::Result<std::option::Option<(rustc::ty::Instance<'tcx>, rustc::mir::interpret::Scalar, usize)>, rustc::mir::interpret::EvalError<'tcx>>
              found std::result::Result<std::option::Option<(rustc::ty::Instance<'_>, rustc::mir::interpret::Scalar, usize)>, rustc::mir::interpret::EvalError<'_>>

error[E0495]: cannot infer an appropriate lifetime for autoref due to conflicting requirements
  --> src/tls.rs:95:36
   |
95 |             self.data.thread_local.range_mut((start, Unbounded))
   |                                    ^^^^^^^^^
   |
note: first, the lifetime cannot outlive the anonymous lifetime #1 defined on the method body at 85:5...
  --> src/tls.rs:85:5
   |
85 | /     fn fetch_tls_dtor(
86 | |         &mut self,
87 | |         key: Option<TlsKey>,
88 | |     ) -> EvalResult<'tcx, Option<(ty::Instance<'tcx>, Scalar, TlsKey)>> {
...  |
105| |         return Ok(None);
106| |     }
   | |_____^
note: ...so that reference does not outlive borrowed content
  --> src/tls.rs:95:13
   |
95 |             self.data.thread_local.range_mut((start, Unbounded))
   |             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
note: but, the lifetime must be valid for the lifetime 'tcx as defined on the impl at 21:1...
  --> src/tls.rs:21:1
   |
21 | impl<'a, 'mir, 'tcx: 'mir + 'a> MemoryExt<'tcx> for Memory<'a, 'mir, 'tcx, Evaluator<'tcx>> {
   | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   = note: ...so that the expression is assignable:
           expected std::result::Result<std::option::Option<(rustc::ty::Instance<'tcx>, rustc::mir::interpret::Scalar, usize)>, rustc::mir::interpret::EvalError<'tcx>>
              found std::result::Result<std::option::Option<(rustc::ty::Instance<'_>, rustc::mir::interpret::Scalar, usize)>, rustc::mir::interpret::EvalError<'_>>

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors
```
